alert.note: Alert for San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; San Francisco River Valley; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 12:25PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL CATRON COUNTY THROUGH 100 PM MDT... At 1225 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Apache Creek, or 15 miles northeast of Reserve, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aragon, Cruzville, Old Horse Springs, Apache Creek and Quemado Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; San Francisco River Valley; Southwest Mountains
